file_content.text: If I move the wounded here, and repair the wall, I believe we can hold Guardian Hold Six ourselves. The Republic needs its troops in Axial Park.
I take it the Republic is preparing a large offensive front.
Sounds like a big mission.
Where is Axial Park?
Axial Park?
Nearby. The most beautiful parkland in the Republic--until the first bombs fell.
If you need garrison troops, I have the ear of the Jedi Council.
I can requisition men for you.
No, I will not take them from important duties.
Another of our fortresses, Guardian Hold Four, is in Axial Park; we've had reports that it, too, has fallen to the enemy.
The Republic is planning a push. They hope to overcome the Imperials, and retake Guardian Hold Four, with sheer force of numbers.
Now this Guardian Hold is secure, our place is in Axial Park.
They will need our help.
A military operation that size, concerning a Guardian Hold... I wonder if the First Son is involved.
The First Son might be there.
If Guardian Hold Four is as well-defended as this one, they'd be throwing lives away.
A vain hope.
If you were to succeed first, Master, there might be no need for the Republic to attack.
There is a Republic safe house in Axial Park where you could hold your councils. I shall send word to your allies.
Goodbye, Master. I will try to guard this place well.
I sense Aelan Kalder has fallen. You and your curiosities have teeth.
But the Republic is still crumbling. You grasp at sand, Jedi, and it slips through your fingers.
I know you can hear me, Master. The Emperor can only trap you, not destroy you.
Master Syo, come back to us.
Fascinating.
Remember the words you spoke every day. Say them with me. "There is no emotion, there is peace...."
Think of the Jedi Code.
There is... no ignorance. There is knowledge.
Tharan Cedrax, Master Satele, Master Jaric--they know who you truly are.
Remember your friends.
Syo, you once scolded Duras Fain for five minutes without drawing breath. You can handle this... interloper!
Tharan. And Duras Fain. My friends, years ago.
Years of Jedi training cannot have simply vanished. Fight back.
You're stronger than him, Syo.
Yes. A Jedi's... greatest weapon is his mind.
Enough. You shall watch, Syo, as your pupil suffers for this.
I have nothing to say to you.
Leave me in peace.
Yes. You have your dead to bury.
Another Child of the Emperor has fallen. I consider that a victory.
But Aelan's still dead.
Savor your good humor while you can, Jedi.
Aelan? No. He can't be. Not like this.
I didn't feel anything. A single day couldn't change a whole lifetime of... of good work, he must have become one with the Force....
In the end, dark or light, all things are a part of the Force.
I'm sure he did.
Thank you, Master. That is kind.
I am sorry, but others have suffered today. How did our people fare in the fighting?
What about my troops?
Considering the pain he caused, he doesn't deserve peace.
I doubt it.
Forgive me, but he served the light for many years. I hope you're wrong.
I think you turned the tide; many of Tai Cordan's droids survived the battle.
Gaden-Ko reports many injured Voss commandos, but they should survive, with rest and time.
Your Esh-kha said they suffered great losses, but are tending the wounded. I think. I find him hard to understand.
